title: Prophile: ParMaster
historical_context: This article reflects the hacker culture of the late 1990s, a time when the internet was becoming more mainstream and the perception of hackers was shifting due to media portrayals and law enforcement actions.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This article is a personal profile of the hacker known as ParMaster, detailing his background, experiences in the hacking community, and reflections on the evolution of hacker culture. It provides insights into the mindset of hackers during a transformative period in technology.
summary:
In this personal profile, ParMaster shares his journey from a teenager breaking software copy protections on Apple IIe systems to becoming an adept hacker in X.25 networks. He recounts memorable experiences, including a raid by the US Secret Service that led to the confiscation of sensitive materials, and reflects on the changing landscape of the computer underground. ParMaster's narrative highlights the camaraderie and conflicts within the hacker community, as well as the impact of government and media perceptions on their activities.

The article also touches on the future of the computer underground, expressing concerns about the lack of unity among hackers and the influence of external forces that have shaped their image. ParMaster's candid reflections serve as both a historical account and a call to action for the hacker community to reclaim its collaborative spirit. His experiences and insights provide a unique glimpse into the challenges and triumphs faced by hackers during a pivotal time in the evolution of technology and digital culture.
